goal:
The University of Coimbra is a Portuguese public organization which consists of 8 teaching units (8 faculties: Arts and Humanities, Law, Medicine, Science and Technology, Pharmacy, Economics, Psychology and Educational Sciences, Sport Sciences and Physical Education, as well as the Institute for Interdisciplinary Research and the College of Arts) and 2 research units (University Judicial, and European Court and Institute of Nuclear Sciences Applied to Health). University of Coimbra also has a set of academic extension structure units (Botanical Garden, General Library, Archive of the University of Coimbra, University Press, Science Museum, April 25 Documentation Centre, Gil Vicente's Academic Theatre, Social Services of the University of Coimbra, University Stadium and Health Sciences' Library).
The University of Coimbra pursues a policy of continuous improvement in several areas, in order to ensur high standards of teaching and research. According to University of Coimbra’s statutes, it aims at contributing to: a) the public understanding of the humanities, the arts, science and technology, by promoting and staging initiatives aimed at the dissemination of humanistic, artistic, scientific and technological culture, and making the required resources available; b) the development of society-oriented activities, notably for the dissemination and transfer of knowledge, as well as economic enhancement of scientific knowledge; c) the promotion of effective mobility of teachers and researchers, students and graduates, both at national and international level, particularly in the European space of higher education and among the community of the Portuguese-speaking countries.
Furthermore, the University of Coimbra has targeted the following goals: a) the reinforcement of its presence in the European research space by developing a research policy centered on the promotion of excellence; b) the reinforcement of its presence in the European research space by investing in quality teaching, thus providing the students with comprehensive training adjusted to the needs of the surrounding environment; c) the strengthening of its role in the economic, social and cultural development of the country, by increasing its capability to intervene at national and international and by intensifying the connections with the society and its surrounding environment.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Climate Action, Culture, Education, Energy, Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Sport, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
University of Coimbra has been involved in several initiatives both scientific and strategic through the university rectory, researchers and local authorities.
Doctor João Malva, has been participating in meetings at Brussels to discuss and share knowledge/information regarding European Innovation Partnership Active & Healthy Ageing: EIP-AHA. Doctor Pedro Caeiro has been participating in expert group on EU Criminal Policy.
